shops.mixins module#

class shops.mixins.ProductMixin#

Bases: shops.mixins.ShopMixin

Mixin for Product views. This mixin inherite from ShopMixin, and keep Permission verification. It only add the product context.

add_context_objects()#

Override to add more context objects for the view.

add_product_object()#
get_context_data(**kwargs)#
has_permission()#

Override this method to customize the way permissions are checked.

class shops.mixins.ShopMixin#

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin, django.contrib.auth.mixins.PermissionRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.base.ContextMixin

Mixin for Shop and Product views. For Permission : This mixin check if the user has the permission required. Then, it check if the user is a association manager. If the user is indeed an association manager, he can access forms for other shops. If the user is “only” a shop manager, he is restricted to his own shop and the related products.

Also, add to context a few variable : - is_association_manager, bool - shop, Shop object

add_context_objects()#

Override to add more context objects for the view.

add_shop_object()#

Define shop object. Raise Http404 if shop doesn’t exist.

get_context_data(**kwargs)#
has_permission()#

Override this method to customize the way permissions are checked.

permission_required = None#

shops.models module#

class shops.models.Product(*args, **kwargs)#

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Define a Product object.

Parameters

  • name – Display name, mandatory.

  • is_manual – is the price set manually.

  • manual_price – price if set manually.

  • shop – Related shop.

  • is_active – is the product used.

  • is_removed – is the product removed.

  • unit – unit of the product.

  • correcting_factor – for automatic price.

:param product_image : image of the product, currently via Cloudinary :type name: string :type is_manual: bool :type manual_price: decimal :type shop: :type is_active: bool :type is_removed: bool :type unit: string :type correcting_factor: decimal :type product_image : string

exception DoesNotExist#

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned#

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

UNIT_CHOICES = (('CL', 'cl'), ('G', 'g'))#
category_set#

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

categoryproduct_set#

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

correcting_factor#

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

current_stock_estimated(offset=0)#

Calculate the theorical stock since the last inventory. Used in order to modify the correcting_factor comparing this value with the value given by the next inventory.

deviating_price_from_auto()#
get_automatic_price()#

Return the price calculated over the last stockentry concerning the product. If there is no stock entry realisated, return 0.

get_current_stock_estimated_display(offset=0)#

Return the current stock estimated using human units cl -> L (if more than 1 L) g -> KG (if more than 1 KG) unit -> unit

get_price()#

Return price for product, depending on is_manual

get_strategy_display()#

get_upper_unit_display()#

stockentryproduct_set#

class Child(Model):

unit#

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

update_correcting_factor(next_stock)#

Calculate the corrected correcting_factor comparing the next stock and the one currently calculated. estimated_stock = last_inventory + input - output_estimated real_stock = last_inventory + input - output_real diff = input_estimated - input_real estimated_stock - real_stock = last_inventory + input - output_estimated - last_inventory - input + output_real estimated_stock - real_stock = output_real - output_estimated I need: estimated_stock - real_stock = 0 => output_real = output_estimated output_real = sales * correcting_factor correcting_factor = output_real / sales correcting_factor = (last_inventory + input - real_stock) / sales

If no sales are registered since the last inventory (stock_output = 0), don’t update the correcting factor (it should tend to infinity). It appends when ZeroDivisionError is raised.

class shops.models.Shop(*args, **kwargs)#

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Define a Shop object.

A shop represent a virtual place (can be physical though) where products are sold. Each shop can have several module which can be enable or not by modifying Shop object attributes.

Parameters

  • name (string) – Display name, mandatory.

  • description (string) – Description, mandatory.

  • image (string) – Image, mandatory.

  • correcting_factor_activated (Boolean) – Activation du facteur de correction, mandatory

  • color (string) – Color, mandatory.

Note:

Initial Django Permission (add, change, delete, view) are added.
